author: Staff Reporter
text:
A mobile app has been introduced in Thoothukudi district to track the movement of flying squads and static surveillance teams involved in election work in the six Assembly constituencies.

Smart Track, the mobile app, which uses Bhuvan satellite, would be utilised in the elections, , Collector and District Election Officer M. Ravikumar said here on Thursday.

While other districts used global positioning system (GPS) devices equipped in vehicles assigned for election personnel, Thoothukudi district had started experiencing the new tracking app with GPS facility installed in smart phones. The app is said to be cost-effective.

“It is available for a rent of Rs.1,500 for a GPS device per day and the expenditure incurred on this facility is Rs. 69,000, inclusive of Internet charges and cost of mobile phone”, the Collector said. This facility was installed in twelve phones provided to six flying squads and six static surveillance teams. Designated officers in the election control room could see how much distance the field personnel had covered in the six constituencies. Returning Officers could also keep track of these teams by using an exclusive username and password through their mobile phones.

With the advent of this ‘mobile app’, the election officials could track , speed of vehicles, routes covered and time spent. The first-of-its-kind facility in the State would help the flying squads and static surveillance personnel to be more vigilant and active. These teams had been deployed to prevent any violation of model code of conduct and distribution of money to voters.
title: Mobile app to track flying squads, surveillance teams
